intro: Antidesma japonicum var. liukiuense, commonly known as the Ryukyu antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
